Authors: Sheng-Hua WU, Chia-Ling Wei, Yu-Ting Lin
Title:
Four new species of Aleurodiscus with echinulate
basidiospores
Keywords:
China; corticioid fungi; Taiwan; taxonomy; wood-decaying
fungi
Abstract:
Four new species of Aleurodiscus sensu lato with
echinulate basidiospores are described from East Asia: A. alpinus, A.
pinicola, A. rimosus, and A. sichuanensis. Aleurodiscus alpinus is from
northwest Yunnan of China where it occurs on Rhododendron in montane
habitats. Aleurodiscus pinicola occurs on Pinus in montane settings in
Taiwan and northwest Yunnan. Aleurodiscus rimosus is from subtropical
Taiwan, where it occurs on angiosperms. Aleurodiscus sichuanensis
originates from southwest China on angiosperms in montane environments.
Phylogenetic relationships of these four new species were inferred
respectively from analyses of nuc rDNA 28S D1Â–D2 domains (28S), and a
combined dataset included three gene regions of 28S, nuc rDNA
ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 (ITS), and a portion of the translation elongation factor
1-alpha gene, TEF1.
